meanings.definition: To patch again or repair with a new patch.
meanings.sent1: She is repatching her torn jeans to make them wearable again.
meanings.sent2: The handyman is repatching the roof to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: After the dog chewed on it, she's repatching the chewed-up pillow.
meanings.sent4: The tailor skillfully repatches the torn seams, making the garment good as new.
meanings.sent5: The farmer repatches the fence to keep the mischievous goats from escaping.

meanings.definition: The act of patching something again.
meanings.sent1: The repatching of the old quilt brought back memories of grandma's handiwork.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the repatching on the road where potholes had been filled.
meanings.sent3: The repatching of the worn-out tire made it look like a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent4: The repatching of the painting was done with such care that it looked seamless.
meanings.sent5: The repatching of the torn flag symbolized unity and resilience.

meanings.definition: The process of fixing or mending a patch.
meanings.sent1: The repatching of the boat's sail ensured a smooth sailing experience.
meanings.sent2: The repatching of the torn carpet made the room look neat and tidy.
meanings.sent3: The repatching of the friendship quilt brought friends closer together.
meanings.sent4: The repatching of the old book cover preserved its historical value.
meanings.sent5: The repatching of the worn-out backpack added a touch of creativity to it.
